duties_responsibilities.duty: Create an environment that motivates, educates, supports, and provides necessary resources to optimize research and scholarly output of College of Medicine learners.
Facilitate improvements in the research approval process.
Serve as a liaison between College of Medicine and hospital partners to facilitate clinical and medical education research.
Offer instruction and curriculum development of research and statistics courses and/or lessons, including content development.
Develop resources to provide research education to the College of Medicine community.
Assist the College of Medicine in the support of Undergraduate and Graduate Medical Education programs through mentoring and instruction.
Facilitate communication between hospitals’ Research Committees and College of Medicine learners and assist with the necessary processes.
Deliver lecture series for Graduate Medical Education learners spanning from basics of research through more complex topics in research including statistics.
Develop, direct, and organize College of Medicine-wide Research and Scholarship Day(s) in collaboration with Student Affairs and Staff.
Conduct research in the area of interest and mentor and involve learners in personal research.
Collaborate with faculty in the College of Medicine on conducting and assisting with research projects.
Represent the College of Medicine to advance clinical and medical education research.
Serve in additional roles as determined by the Assistant Dean for Clinical Research to further support research and scholarly pursuit for learners and the College of Medicine’s strategic goals.
Participate in the College of Medicine Research and Scholarship Committee as an appointed member based on job responsibilities as the Research Director for Medical Education.

education_certification.credential: PhD, MD, or DO degree (Medical Degree Preferred)
